ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient's features (Atrial septal defect, Hypoplasia of the radius, Abnormal carpal morphology, Cardiac conduction abnormality) are highly consistent with Holt-Oram syndrome, as seen in the similar reference cases.
TAR syndrome also involves radial hypoplasia and can have cardiac defects, but typically includes thrombocytopenia, which is not mentioned here.
This syndrome can include radial anomalies and cardiac defects, but usually also involves renal and ear anomalies, which are not noted in the patient.
Fanconi anemia can present with radial defects and cardiac anomalies, but typically includes bone marrow failure and other systemic features not mentioned here.
VACTERL can include cardiac and radial defects, but usually involves vertebral, anal, tracheoesophageal, and renal anomalies, which are not noted in this patient.
